Articles.Content: I sometimes hear it mentioned in posts. But I don't know what it is. Can someone tell me?

If you bothered to do a proper search on the forum I am absolutely sure you could have found it yourself. And I am too tired right now to do the search for you.

In April last year something went horribly wrong during a forum software update. Multiple back-ups got corrupted and were rendered unusable. The latest still usable back-up was, if I remember correctly, from November. Everything from between the back-up and the crash was lost. Hundreds of accounts, thousands of post. All gone.

If you bothered to do a proper search on the forum I am absolutely sure you could have found it yourself.

Or, he could ask his friendly fellow forum members, and they could tell him.

There was also another incident much more recently in 2014 where the forums came down for maintenance. This maintenance ended up taking longer than expected and kept the site down for over 24 hours IIRC. Within an hour or two of the site coming back up, it was hacked by some amateur hack-tivists and redirected to their website. Squad pulled the forums back down for several more days while they rectified the issue.

We were forumless for 3-4 days IIRC. It was definitely a few. The loss of content, however, was only a week or two, if at all. There was not a catastrophic content loss but I do believe a few very new people lost accounts in that, perhaps as a safety measure by Squad to ensure that nobody's account data was compromised.

As I recall when Squad did the restore they only had a good back-up to a certain date. Sometime in October 2012 I believe was the date. I believe if you joined by that date your account, posts, rep etc was restored fully. If not, you lost all that. I missed the date and lost reps, post count and my original join date. (I use to post a lot more back then.) But missing that date is what I get from being a long-time lurker and not a joiner. (Now I join every forum on the internet I come across -- by the way I can get people great discounts on leather masks, whips and chains (guess people use them for Halloween?? )

The biggest headache (other then forum withdrawal) was the info that had been posted in the various threads after that date was lost too. (I still have shortcuts to those non-existent threads. I really need to clean-up my desktop one of these days.) Luckily this community is a solid one and we recovered. Plus Squad went to a more robust back-up system and security software.

On a different note, it has become part of KSP lore like the early Kracken, the Magic Boulder (one does not taunt the magic boulder), Capt'n Skunky's comics (really miss those), freakin' invisible giant birds. It's why Kerbals live underground and build rockets to escape Kerbin. The birds eat them. (Ok, I made the last part up, but you have to admit those are some very loud invisible birds.)
